article.title: Strong and radiative decays of excited vector mesons and predictions for a new $φ(1930)$ resonance

multiple_choice_question.text: What process does the Feynman diagram in Figure 1 depict?
What physical phenomenon explains the consistent mass difference between radially and orbitally excited vector mesons as shown in Table 1?
What is the predicted dominant decay mode of the putative φ(1930) resonance according to Table 12?
What method is used in Equation (5) to estimate the mass of the undiscovered φ(???) state?
choices: Mass difference comparison with known states in the nonet
Fitting to experimental data from radiative decays
